page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There are seven children in Kilchrenan Primary School and their parents' occupations are a good indication of the variety of employment in this community. Katrina's dad is a farmer and her mum is a home-help and a part-time barmaid. Dougie's dad is a farmer and his mum is a housewife and does school transport. Lorne's dad works with the Hydro-Electric Board and his mum is a housewife. David's dad is a security officer and his mum is our teacher. Dominic's gramp is a shepherd and his mum is a housekeeper. Liam's dad works in life insurance and his mum runs a guest house. Arran's dad works for the Forestry Commission and his mum is the manageress of the community co-op. Three of the fathers have to travel approximately 100 miles to their work, which is not unusual here.
